title: Farewell Zubeen: Lakhs gather for Assam's beloved singer's final journey
content: Assam mourns the loss of Zubeen Garg, a celebrated singer and composer, with a state funeral planned in Kamarkuchi village. Thousands of fans paid their respects in Guwahati, while Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma oversaw arrangements and tributes poured in. A second post-mortem was conducted for transparency, and memorials were held across the state to honor Zubeen's legacy.

title: Kolkata flooded: Pandals submerged, streets underwater, cars stranded - videos show havoc
content: Kolkata faced immense disruption as torrential overnight rainfall led to widespread flooding, paralyzing the city. Public transport, including trains and Metro services, was suspended, and streets became submerged, stranding vehicles. Tragically, at least three people died due to electrocution in the rain-affected areas. The IMD has warned of continued heavy rainfall in several South Bengal districts.

title: R Ashwin gears up for new overseas challenge – major update revealed
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, after retiring from international cricket and the IPL, is embarking on a busy second innings. He's set to participate in both the ILT20 in the UAE and the Big Bash League in Australia, attracting interest from multiple BBL franchises. Before these commitments, Ashwin will also represent India at the Hong Kong Sixes, adding star value to the side.

title: He is ‘superhuman’: Nvidia CEO praises Musk; says xAI did in 19 what take years to do
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang lauded Elon Musk and xAI for building a massive AI supercluster in Memphis in just 19 days, a feat Huang deemed "superhuman." The multi-billion dollar Memphis Supercluster aims to significantly advance AI capabilities. In related news, Nvidia announced a $100 billion investment in OpenAI, supplying advanced data center chips.

title: It's offical! Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal announce pregnancy: 'best chapter of our lives'
content: Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif have officially announced they are expecting their first child. The couple shared the joyous news with a heartwarming picture on Instagram, where they are seen wearing matching white outfits. In the picture, Vicky is tenderly cradling Katrina's baby bump.

title: Watch: Protests sweep Italy over Gaza war; call to recognise Palestine
content: Massive protests erupted across Italy due to the Gaza crisis. Workers and protesters mobilised, leading to strikes and transport disruptions. Milan saw clashes with police as demonstrators stormed a train station. Unions demanded Italy sever ties with Israel. Demonstrations occurred in Rome, Bologna, Turin, and other cities. Dock workers slowed operations at ports.

title: Haris Rauf made jets downing gesture not once but twice against India - watch
content: Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf ignited controversy during the Asia Cup Super 4s match against India with politically charged gestures, including mimicking fighter jet crashes and displaying '6-0' signals towards Indian fans, referencing unverified claims about downing Indian jets during Operation Sindoor.

title: H-1B visa hike: White House raises alarm; Says 40,000 US tech jobs lost to foreigners
content: President Trump introduced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications, citing program abuse and American job losses. The White House claims companies are replacing American tech workers with lower-paid foreign labor, impacting national security. Trump aims to protect American workers by increasing costs for companies utilizing the H-1B program and prioritizing American-born workers in employment gains.

title: Movie tickets to not cost more than Rs 200? Karnataka HC says no; stays state govt order
content: The Karnataka High Court has temporarily suspended the state government's order that capped cinema ticket prices at Rs 200. This decision follows petitions from multiplexes, theatre owners, and film producers who argued the cap was arbitrary and detrimental to their business. The court's intervention puts the price regulation on hold, pending further deliberation on its validity and impact.

title: Boardroom slogans, broken payslips: Why India’s gender pay gap won’t budge
content: Despite the rhetoric of empowerment echoing through boardrooms, India’s gender pay gap remains glaring. Women continue to earn significantly less, with the IT sector emerging as the worst offender, followed by real estate, FMCG, and banking. Career breaks and workplace bias drive the disparity, while professionals demand pay transparency and performance-based growth to break entrenched inequities.

title: H-1B fee hike: Netflix cofounder defends new price, says its ‘great solution’
content: Netflix's co-founder Reed Hastings surprisingly supports Donald Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move against Silicon Valley's disapproval. Hastings believes it will reserve H-1B visas for high-value jobs, eliminating the lottery system. However, the White House clarified it's a one-time fee for new petitions, not annual.

title: Ahmedabad: Dog lover police inspector dies of 'rabies'; had no known animal bite
content: Ahmedabad police inspector Vanrajsinh Manjariya, 50, died from suspected rabies despite having no recent animal bite history. He developed sudden high fever, hydrophobia, and aerophobia, leading to multiple organ failure and cardiac arrest. Samples were sent to NIV Pune for confirmation, while colleagues remember him as an animal lover and efficient officer.

title: 'If talks won games, they would have won': Harbhajan on India-Pakistan contests
content: Harbhajan Singh criticized Pakistani players after their Asia Cup performance. India defeated Pakistan in both encounters. Singh highlighted the experienced players' failure to deliver. He pointed out their focus on verbal tactics over actual performance. Indian batsmen dominated, forming strong partnerships. Pakistani bowlers struggled to take wickets. Singh emphasized the importance of on-field performance over off-field aggression.

title: Maharashtra: Rape survivor bleeds to death after doctor gives her abortion pill
content: A 17-year-old rape survivor in Yavatmal district tragically died from severe blood loss after an abortion attempt. The Class 12 student, pregnant due to repeated assaults by her tuition teacher, was given an abortion pill by a doctor in Pusad. Her father sought the abortion discreetly.

title: Obamas’ Italy getaway: Barack and Michelle aboard Spielberg’s $250 million yacht
content: Barack and Michelle Obama recently vacationed in Portofino, Italy, aboard Steven Spielberg's superyacht, dispelling marriage trouble rumors. Michelle arrived first, followed by Barack with a security entourage. They were seen enjoying breakfast and lunch together. This public appearance follows Barack's lighthearted remarks about their marriage and Michelle's podcast denial of any marital issues.

title: National film awards: Shah Rukh, Mohanlal & others to receive - when & where you can watch
content: Shah Rukh Khan's first National Award win after 33 years highlights the 71st National Film Awards. The ceremony, scheduled for September 23, 2025, in New Delhi, will be hosted by President Droupadi Murmu. '12th Fail' won Best Feature Film, with Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey sharing Best Actor. The event will be streamed live on DD News YouTube.

title: Inderjit Singh Gosal, man who took over from Nijjar, held in Canada
content: Inderjit Singh Gosal, the leader of Canada's Khalistan referendum campaign following Hardeep Singh Nijjar's death, has been arrested by Canadian police on firearms charges. Gosal, also a coordinator for the terror group Sikhs for Justice with alleged links to Babbar Khalsa International, was previously accused of violence at a Toronto temple.

title: 'Tea celebration': Pak footballer's antics amid Haris Rauf gesture row - Watch
content: India U-17 football team defeated Pakistan 3-2 in a thrilling SAFF U-17 Championship match. The victory was overshadowed by Muhammad Abdullah's controversial 'tea-sipping' celebration after scoring, perceived as a taunt referencing a 2019 incident involving an Indian pilot. This followed Pakistani cricketer Haris Rauf's similar gesture during an Asia Cup match, further fueling tensions.

title: Watch: Denmark airport shut after unidentified drones sighted; 40 flights cancelled
content: Copenhagen Airport was forced to shut down for several hours on Monday evening due to the sighting of unidentified drones in its airspace, leading to numerous flight cancellations and diversions. Police reported that larger-than-usual drones were observed flying around the airport. Similar drone sightings also caused a temporary shutdown at Oslo's main airport, adding to the travel disruptions across Europe.

title: Mystery in Lutyens' Delhi: 85-year-old British woman ‘fall’ turns out to be murder
content: The death of Pauline Crowther Ann, an 85-year-old British woman residing on Jantar Mantar Lane in New Delhi, initially believed to be accidental, has now been classified as murder. Postmortem reports revealed strangulation as the cause of death, prompting a police investigation led by DCP Devesh Mahla. The British High Commission has been notified about the case.

title: ‘India a pivotal voice’: UN backs calls for UNSC reform; reflect ‘world of 2025, not 1945’
content: UN secretary-general Antonio Guterres supports UNSC reform to mirror current global dynamics, acknowledging India's growing influence. While the decision on permanent membership rests with member states, India actively seeks a seat, emphasizing its qualifications. The UN also voices concerns about rising global protectionism and its detrimental effects on global development and economic stability.

title: Pro-Palestinian strikes, blockades across Italy
content: Across Italy, pro-Palestinian demonstrations, strikes, and blockades erupted in response to union calls denouncing the "genocide in Gaza" and demanding sanctions against Israel. These mobilisations coincided with growing international recognition of a Palestinian state, contrasting with Italy's cautious stance under Giorgia Meloni's government, which remains reluctant to recognise Palestine or impose trade sanctions on Israel amid the intensified Israeli military operation in Gaza.

title: Crimes against humanity: Former Philippine President Duterte indicted by ICC
content: Rodrigo Duterte, the former Philippine president, faces ICC charges for crimes against humanity related to his war on drugs. Accused of involvement in numerous murders during his time as mayor and president, Duterte is currently detained in The Hague. His lawyer claims he is unfit for trial due to cognitive impairment, while supporters allege political motivation behind the case.

title: 80th UNGA: Trump to address UN after slashing funding - $500m budget cut, 20% jobs lost
content: At the UN General Assembly, President Trump is set to address the body amid US funding cuts and withdrawals from key agencies. His speech will highlight his administration's achievements and critique globalist institutions.

title: Bengaluru cab driver stabs woman 11 times, kills her as daughter watches in horror
content: In Bengaluru, a 32-year-old telecaller was fatally stabbed by her husband in public, witnessed by their daughter, following a heated argument. The couple, in their second marriage, worked at the same call center. Separately, police are searching for a man who allegedly murdered his father for property, with an accomplice already in custody after CCTV footage exposed the crime.

title: How having cumin water first thing in the morning can prevent heart disease
content: The main risk factor for heart disease development is hypertension, which doctors call high blood pressure. The natural vasodilator compounds in cumin, expand blood vessels to decrease vascular resistance which results in lower blood pressure levels. The potassium content in cumin helps regulate sodium levels, while causing blood vessel muscle relaxation which helps maintain normal blood pressure

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex up over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday after being pulled into red the previous trading session after Donald Trump administration hiked H-1B visa fees.

title: Pills, pregnancy and politics: Trump links Tylenol to autism: what is it?
content: Donald Trump has ignited controversy by advising pregnant individuals to avoid Tylenol, citing a potential link to autism despite lacking scientific consensus. Medical experts swiftly condemned his remarks, emphasizing the safety of acetaminophen during pregnancy and the importance of vaccines. Conflicting studies on acetaminophen and autism highlight the need for further research, with health professionals urging consultation before making changes.

title: 'Entertaining': Suryavanshi stamps authority in Australia with whirlwind knock - Watch
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, fresh off his England stint, ignited India U19's chase against Australia U19 with a blistering 38. After an early wobble, Abhigyan Kundu (87*) and Vedant Trivedi (61*) forged an unbeaten 152-run partnership, securing a dominant seven-wicket victory in the first Youth ODI. Team India leads the three-match series after this commanding performance.

title: Taylor Swift got man arrested at fiancé Travis Kelce’s house amid Justin Baldoni lawsuit
content: A process server was arrested at Travis Kelce's home while attempting to serve Taylor Swift deposition papers related to Justin Baldoni's legal battle with Blake Lively. Swift is trying to distance herself from the dispute, citing manipulation and security concerns. Her strained relationship with Lively adds to the tension as the case heads towards trial.

title: Hamas publicly executes three Palestinians; accused of collaborating with Israel
content: Hamas gunmen publicly executed three Palestinians in Gaza on Sunday, accusing them of collaborating with Israel. The killings occurred outside Shifa Hospital in Gaza City, a focal point of Israeli operations. Armed groups, including the Qassam Brigades, reportedly participated. One victim, Yasser Abu Shabab, was labeled a 'major collaborator' leading a clan opposing Hamas.

title: Ballon d’Or: Dembele edges out Yamal; Bonmati clinches 3rd consecutive award
content: Ousmane Dembele secured the Ballon d'Or 2025 after a stellar season, leading Paris Saint-Germain to a Champions League victory. Dembele's transformation into a prolific centre-forward, guided by coach Luis Enrique, resulted in 35 goals and a domestic double. Aitana Bonmati won the Women’s Ballon d’Or for the third consecutive year.

title: Kidney health and potassium: Why too much or too little can be risky
content: Potassium is vital for health, but it poses risks when kidneys fail. Kidneys filter excess potassium, but kidney disease impairs this function. High potassium is common in chronic kidney disease. It can cause muscle weakness and heart issues. Low potassium also harms kidney patients. Managing potassium in kidney disease requires balance.

title: ‘True to the historic commitment’: France recognises Palestinian state at UN
content: France formally recognised the state of Palestine at the UN General Assembly, joined by several other nations, as world leaders pushed for a two-state solution. Despite opposition from Israel and criticism from the US, the move reflects a growing global consensus, offering a glimmer of hope amid ongoing conflict and devastation in Gaza.

title: Kirk threat, missing stalker: Taylor Swift’s security on high alert
content: Taylor Swift's security team is on high alert as her alleged stalker, Brian Jason Wagner, has disappeared despite a restraining order. Wagner's evasion of authorities and unsettling behavior have prompted heightened security measures, including covert operations at public events. Swift's team prioritizes her safety above all else, adjusting promotional plans and routines until the matter is resolved.

title: NFL: Will Derrick Henry play against Detroit Lions tonight?
content: After a Week 1 loss to the Bills and a Week 2 win against the Browns, the Baltimore Ravens are set to face the Detroit Lions tonight. Derrick Henry, the Ravens' star running back, is confirmed to play, despite past injuries. Henry has urged his team to improve following their recent performance, emphasizing the need for greater efficiency and explosiveness.

title: Lions use dominant rushing attack, relentless pass rush to grab big road win
content: Detroit overwhelmed Baltimore at the line of scrimmage to pull away for a big early-season road victory.

title: Sources: VanVleet has torn ACL, may miss season
content: Rockets star guard Fred VanVleet suffered a torn ACL during a recent workout and could potentially miss the entirety of the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: Ravens' Henry baffled by third fumble in 3 games
content: Running back Derrick Henry's third fumble in three games played a pivotal role in the Baltimore Ravens' 38-30 loss to the Detroit Lions Monday night. He told reporters after the defeat that "I'm at a loss for words. ... I ain't going to lie to y'all."

title: 49ers DE Bosa out for season with torn right ACL
content: 49ers Pro Bowl defensive end Nick Bosa tore his right ACL during Sunday's 16-15 victory against the Cardinals at Levi's Stadium, and he will need season-ending surgery.

title: Falcons fire WR coach Hilliard after offense flops
content: The Falcons fired wide receivers coach Ike Hilliard on Monday, one day after being routed by the Panthers, the team announced.

title: Chargers RB Harris out for year, Harbaugh says
content: Tests confirmed that Los Angeles Chargers running back Najee Harris, who collapsed on a play in the second quarter Sunday during his team's win over the Denver Broncos, suffered a season-ending torn Achilles, coach Jim Harbaugh said Monday.

title: Cowboys' Jones: IR a consideration for WR Lamb
content: Cowboys Pro Bowl wide receiver CeeDee Lamb could miss three to four weeks because of a high left ankle sprain suffered in Sunday's loss to the Bears, according to a source.

title: Pack's LaFleur wasn't happy with undefeated talk
content: Packers coach Matt LaFleur said Monday that he wasn't happy with the "undefeated" talk coming from the locker room last week.

title: 🏆Ranking A'ja Wilson's WNBA MVP seasons
content: A year ago, A'ja Wilson played arguably the best season in WNBA history. Where does her 2025 MVP season rank?

title: Indiana’s rise, Clemson’s face-plant and more we didn’t see coming
content: Four weeks in, there's no real favorite to win it all or take home the Heisman. Here's what we think we know.

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season tips off.

title: Ranking every player in the 2025 Ryder Cup, from Scheffler to McIlroy to Højgaard
content: Team USA and Europe will meet at Bethpage Black for Ryder Cup bragging rights. We're breaking down every player competing in this year's tournament.

title: Ryder Cup 2025: Reliving Team Europe's away wins as Donald aims for fantastic fifth
content: Team Europe, amid its recent success at home, has managed just four victories overseas against Team USA.

title: Big questions: Have Lions' coordinators found their groove? How concerning is Cowboys' D?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game.

title: MLB October pitching tiers: Who has the No. 1 playoff rotation?
content: Aces matter in the postseason. Here are the contenders who are flush with them -- and which are lacking quality arms.

title: Battle for the AL Central: An improbable Guardians comeback and epic Tigers collapse﻿
content: With a week left in the regular season, Detroit and Cleveland are separated by one game atop the division.

title: How the Fever stunned the Aces and stole Game 1 in the WNBA semifinals
content: Kelsey Mitchell and Indiana stunned Las Vegas in Game 1. What's next for both teams in the WNBA semifinals?

title: Offseason survey: Best and worst moves, LeBron's future and Finals picks
content: League insiders share their picks for the Finals, most head-scratching moves of the summer and LeBron's next decision.

title: Why Dembélé's Ballon d'Or win over Yamal feels like the dawn of a new era
content: Ousmane Dembélé and Lamine Yamal, this year's top two in the Ballon d'Or voting, have a lot in common when it comes to how their energetic, attacking play is a welcome antidote in the tactics-driven world of modern soccer.

title: Pete Carroll is accountable for losses, but will he make changes?
content: The promising start of the Carroll era with the Raiders has taken a negative turn. How will Carroll react?

title: The VAR Review: Explaining Bruno Fernandes' 'offside,' Robert Sánchez's red card, Newcastle's penalty claim
content: Looking at Robert Sánchez's red card for Chelsea at Manchester United, a possible offside on Bruno Fernandes' goal and a potential penalty.

title: MLS: How high can LAFC climb with Son leading a dynamic attack?
content: Pairing Son Heung-min with Denis Bouanga has given LAFC one of the most fearsome attacks in the league, but were they able to break into the top five of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: NWSL: Marta's Orlando Pride in nine-game rut
content: Orlando have stretched their winless rut to a calamitous nine straight games and are desperately clinching on to a playoff position. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Fantasy football pickups: Trey Benson next man up; Raiders' offense still has value
content: Highlighting available free agent options after yet another injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 4.

title: Risers, questions and notes: Could USC have two high-pick receivers?
content: What are scouts saying about Makai Lemon? Is Fernando Mendoza now ready for the QB1 title? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 3.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vinícius Jr's future at Madrid in doubt
content: Vinícius Júnior's future at Real Madrid reportedly remains uncertain with his contract expiring in 2027. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: Four-team mock draft strategy: When to draft Tkachuk, Kucherov and others
content: Four-team leagues are rising in popularity, so our experts mock drafted their teams for a H2H points league.

title: Doddasaggere botanical garden in Karnataka sees rise in number of species, including near-threatened and rare ones
content: Doddasaggere Botanical Garden, planned to be developed on 228 acres, would be the second biggest botanical garden in Karnataka, and the third biggest in India

title: Constable posted outside Haryana minister's Gurugram residence found dead
content: The constable was deployed as the security personnel outside Narbir Singh’s residence in the civil lines area after he became a minister following the 2024 assembly elections, police said

title: 1xBet online betting app case: Yuvraj Singh appears before Directorate of Enforcement
content: The agency questioned the all-rounder and left-hand batter and recorded his statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), the officials said

title: Unemployment biggest problem facing youth, it is directly linked to 'vote chori': Rahul
content: When a Government wins public trust and comes to power, its first duty is to provide employment and opportunities to the youth, Rahul said.

title: All accused in social media slander case against Kerala CPI(M) leader K.J. Shine fail to appear before SIT
content: SIT had issued notices to C.K. Gopalakrishnan, K.M. Shajahan, and Yasar to appear at Aluva cyber police station on Tuesday morning

title: AIADMK cadre give warm welcome to Palaniswami in Sengottaiyan’s turf Gobichettipalayam
content: This was Mr. Palaniswami’s first visit to the constituency after the removal of Mr. Sengottaiyan from his party posts

title: Singer Zubeen Garg’s body consigned to flames amid gun salute
content: Members of the Garg's family, including his wife Garima, paid tributes to the singer at the cremation site

title: Minor volcanic eruptions noticed in Andaman’s Barren Island
content: Barren Island in Andaman and Nicobar Islands experiences minor volcanic eruptions, India’s only active volcano, officials report

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly session from October 14: Speaker
content: The supplementary budget estimates for 2025-26 will be presented in the House during the session, M. Appavu said

title: Forest (Amendment) Bill offers new hope for Sandalwood farmers in Kerala
content: The Bill has provisions for the sale of sandalwood trees on private land through the Forest depots, and the price of the timber will be made available to the farmer.

title: Customs raids Dulquer Salmaan, Prithviraj Sukumaran’s residences over illegally imported premium vehicles in Kerala
content: Residences and premises of high-net-worth individuals in Kerala, including prominent actors and industrialists, were raided as part of a crackdown on the alleged illegal import of premium vehicles numbering over 100 from Bhutan

title: IIIT-Bengaluru develops smart panels to boost 5G and shape 6G networks
content: One of the biggest advantages of these panels is that they can be easily added to existing 5G-Advanced networks

title: Several feared dead in Kolkata as overnight torrential rains lash the city and its suburbs
content: The city received about 247. 5 mm rainfall in the past 24 hours leading to waterlogging in several neighbourhoods. Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim urged people to stay indoors. The deaths were due to electrocution

title: Rains LIVE: Electrocution, waterlogging claim 7 lives in Kolkata
content: In western Maharashtra, torrential rains over the past 24 hours left one person dead and 14 people stranded in floodwaters

title: Bengaluru study finds children in urban slums suffering from ‘moderate child food poverty’ despite government nutrition programmes
content: Children from poorer households, nuclear families, and with less-educated mothers were more at risk. Food restrictions during illness further worsened nutrition, said the study

title: Opposition slams U.P. Government’s ban on caste-based political rallies, calls move an ‘eyewash’
content: The Congress described the decision as dangerous and an eyewash to silent voices emerging from the Dalit, backwards, marginalised and other subaltern communities.

title: Over 1.37 lakh metric tonnes of fresh fruit, including apples, dispatched outside Kashmir in 10 days: J&K Government
content: The movement of fresh fruit, especially apples, was halted due to heavy rains that resulted in the closure of the Srinagar-Jammu National Highway for three weeks

title: H-1B’s new $100k visa fee: Why young Indian women are most at risk
content: The impact will be particularly felt by women H-1B beneficiaries as they generally earn less than men

title: Heavy rain likely in Odisha due to fresh low-pressure area over Bay of Bengal
content: Heavy rainfall would occur in the districts of Sundargarh, Sambalpur, Deogarh, Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj, Jharsuguda, Angul, Boudh, Sonepur, Malkangiri, Koraput, Nabarangpur, and Kalahandi on September 23

title: Focus is on IT, but not at the cost of agriculture, says A.P. CM Naidu
content: Naidu asks MLAs and MLCs to spend a day every month in the fields, interact with the farmers and solve their problems

title: Under BJP rule, Odisha reports 37,611 crimes against women in just 14 months
content: Molestation tops the list with 9,181 cases, followed by abduction of women (8,227), non-dowry torture (6,134), and dowry torture (5,464).

title: NC MP Ruhullah seeks immediate, unconditional release of rights activist Khurram Parvez
content: For over 1,400 days, the BJP-RSS regime has kept Kashmiri human rights defender Khurram Parvez in unlawful captivity, says National Conference (NC) leader and MP Aga Syed Ruhullah

title: Supreme Court assigns CBI plea on Shivakumar case to Justice Kant’s Bench
content: CBI filed the petition after Karnataka govt. revoked the consent given to the probe agency to investigate the disproportionate assets case against Shivakumar

title: Students launch protest in Dehradun against paper leak, says anti-cheating law is no deterrent
content: Demanding justice for those who spent months preparing for exams and ended up losing it to paper leak, students alleged that the anti-cheating law remain no deterrent for the cheating mafias in the State.

title: Uttar Pradesh government issues order prohibiting caste-based political rallies in State
content: Notification follows directive by Allahabad HC on Sept. 16 to curb glorification of caste and its mention in police cases; Oppn. alleges BJP itself held caste rallies and conferences in the past

title: British PM Keir Starmer likely to visit India in October
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Mr. Starmer will hold summit-level talks during the visit, which comes a little more than two months after Mr. Modi visited the U.K. to attend the signing of the U.K.-India free trade agreement.

title: Government announces ₹1,000 crore programme to drive innovation, entrepreneurial growth across Karnataka
content: The Department of Electronics, IT and BT on Monday unveiled a ₹1,000-crore Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP) to drive innovation across the State

title: Gang of four loots ₹1.5 crore from the house of professor in Bengaluru
content: The accused barged into the house claiming to be from the government and was conducting a search and seizure operation

title: Nine-year-old girl sexually assaulted by head of children’s home in Hosur
content: The police have arrested five persons in connection with the crime and attempt to cover it up. Among them are the director of the home, his wife, and a pastor of a local church

title: Canteens operated by Mahalir Thittam SHGs to be opened in Tamil Nadu’s government colleges
content: The institutions have been advised to allocate suitable space on the campuses to set up the canteens and ensure basic facilities such as water, electricity, and waste management support

title: Congress MLA’s call for coalition govt. after 2026 poll sparks divide in Tamil Nadu Congress Committee
content: Among a section of Congress functionaries, there is a feeling that the ruling DMK has kept allies at a distance, hardly consulting them or hearing their grievances

title: Following Allahabad HC’s directives, Uttar Pradesh prohibits caste mention in FIR, political rallies, public signs
content: Ordering a prohibition on caste-based rallies, officiating Chief Secretary (CS) Deepak Kumar said they are organised for political purposes and promote caste conflict in society, which is contrary to “public order” and “national unity.”

title: Plea in Delhi High Court seeks removal of graves of Afzal Guru, Maqbool Bhatt from Tihar jail premises
content: The plea sought directions to authorities to relocate the mortal remains, if necessary, to a secret location to prevent “glorification of terrorism” and misuse of jail premises

title: Assam CM orders autopsy of Garg’s remains after aide is accused of ‘overworking singer’
content: The Chief Minister stated that a post-mortem was ordered in response to public demand. Fans will have the opportunity to pay their last respects to Zubeen

title: Odisha Speaker rejects no-confidence motion moved by Congress
content: The rejection of no-confidence motion notice was deliberate, alleged Congress Legislature Party leader Ramachandra Kadam

title: Doctors’ strike hits healthcare services in Manipur
content: Protesting the assault of a colleague, the State unit of the Indian Medical Association and other medical bodies announced a 24-hour suspension of services at private and government facilities from 6 a.m. on September 23

title: Two killed as three-storey building collapses in Indore
content: District Collector Shivam Verma said that 14 members of a family were trapped under the debris of the building.

title: Tamil Nadu govt. to sign MoU with Railways in December for CMRL takeover of MRTS
content: At a high-level meeting held on Monday, the State government gave in-principle approval for the signing of the MoU. The government also approved the Comprehensive Mobility Plan for Chennai

title: India, Morocco sign defence cooperation MoU to boost strategic partnership
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh also announces opening of a new Defence Wing at the Embassy of India in Rabat, Morocco’s capital; the MoU establishes a robust institutional framework for expanding ties, paving the way for collaboration in defence industry, joint exercises, military training, and capacity building

title: Indian Navy scales up indigenous shipbuilding with 54 vessels under construction
content: 54 vessels are currently under various stages of construction in Indian shipyards; several ships are nearing delivery, with a few to be commissioned this year; India has set a target of expanding naval strength to over 200 warships and submarines by 2035

title: Government specifies tasks of Ministries during calamities
content: The Home Ministry said the Defence Ministry “shall have the responsibility for monitoring, early warning, prevention, mitigation, preparedness and capacity building” with regard to disaster arising from avalanche and oil spills

title: Chennai’s Victoria Public Hall is likely to be inaugurated next month after retrofitting
content: A city museum will come up downstairs in the 2,200-square metre structure, while the galleries upstairs will host music and arts events.  A decision on a sound and light show is likely to be taken later

title: Seat-sharing talks in grand alliance positive, allies to decide CM face: Congress
content: “Sadaqat Ashram (Congress party’s Patna headquarters) happened to be the centre of fight against Britishers and it will again turn into centre of the second war of Independence”, Mr. Allavaru said

title: Social, educational survey hit by technical glitches in Dharwad
content: Mobile application not opening, OTP errors and network issues were the most common problems faced by enumerators at the start of the survey

title: Senior Army officers visit J&K’s Chenab Valley to review operational preparedness
content: The Indian Army is conducting twin anti-militancy operations in the Chenab Valley’s Kishtwar, and Doda-Udhampur belt since Friday evening

title: Number of polluted river sites shows slight reduction: CPCB
content: Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand had the most number of polluted sites; yet, there was a reduction in the number of river locations across India considered ‘most polluted’

title: Madhya Pradesh man lynched in Rajasthan’s Bhilwara on suspicion of cow smuggling
content: The victim, Aasif Babu Multani, and his cousin Mohsin, residents of Mandsaur’s Multanpur, were returning after buying cattle for their agricultural and dairy needs from a cattle mart in Bhilwara’s Lambia Raila, when they were attacked

title: CISF takes over security of upcoming Noida International Airport at Jewar in Uttar Pradesh
content: (photos sent on Delhi netdesk Whatsapp group) The airport, on the outskirts of Delhi, will be the 70th airport in the country to come under CISF cover

title: Ukraine Braces As Russia Steps Up Drive To Seize Donetsk's Fortress Belt
content: Russia now controls about 70% of the Donetsk region. Ukraine's forces have been pushed back to a string of four cities that analysts have dubbed its "fortress belt," where they've repelled Moscow's efforts to seize the region for years.

title: Women Outnumber Men Picked For NASA's Astronaut Class, First In 6 Decades
content: NASA's next class of 10 astronaut candidates includes more women than men for the first time in the space agency's more than 60-year history.

title: New Zealand Mother Guilty Of Killing 2 Children, Stashing Bodies In Suitcase
content: Hakyung Lee, a New Zealand citizen originally from South Korea, was extradited from Seoul in 2022 after the remains of her children were discovered in suitcases left at a storage unit in south Auckland.

title: Courts Cannot Act As Recovery Agents For Collection Of Money: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has observed that courts cannot act as recovery agents and deprecated the trend of turning civil disputes into criminal cases by parties in dispute.

title: "Ramlila, Durga Puja Can't End At 10 PM": Delhi's Loudspeaker Rules Eased
content: Loudspeakers at Ramlila performances, Durga Puja pandals and other religious events during Navratri can now be operated till midnight, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said today, announcing a two-hour relaxation in the ban on loudspeakers post 10 pm.

title: Delhi High Court's Unusual "Amul Chach, Pizza" Order In Neighbours' Fight Over Pets
content: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday, in an unusual order, told two neighbours fighting over pets to "serve buttermilk and pizzas" to children.

title: How Much AI Does Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan Use? What He Told NDTV
content: Dharmendra Pradhan outlined his vision for AI in education and its role in strengthening students' learning.

title: Maruti Sold 30,000 Cars, Hyundai 11,000 On 1st Day Of Navratri Amid GST Cuts
content: The auspicious start of Navratri, amplified by the momentum from the GST 2.0 reforms, has infused strong positivity into the automobile market, with car dealers registering robust sales across the country.

title: Explained: Why US Is Considering Leucovorin For Autism Treatment
content: Leucovorin has been approved by the US Food and Drug Administration for counteracting the toxic effects of certain cancer drugs, like methotrexate, that block the body's use of folate.

title: Suspecting Affair, Bengaluru Man Stabs Wife To Death In Front Of Daughter
content: A 28-year-old woman was stabbed to death by her husband in front of her 12-year-old daughter at a bus stand in Bengaluru, police said.

title: "False Hindu God": Republican Leader's Remark On Hanuman Statue In US Sparks Row
content: A Texas Republican leader has come under fire over his remarks on a 90-foot statue of lord Hanuman--known as the 'Statue of Union' -- in the US city.

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court Allows 14-Year-Old Rape Survivor To Undergo Abortion
content: The girl, who was 28 weeks pregnant, had initially faced resistance from her parents, but they agreed to the procedure after court-directed counselling.

title: "I Was Curious": Afghan Boy Hides In Plane's Landing Gear, Reaches Delhi
content: A 13-year-old Afghan boy's "curiosity" brought him to Delhi from Afghanistan after he somehow managed to get inside the landing gear compartment of an aircraft that took off from Kabul, official sources said on Monday.

title: "No Link": US Epidemiologist Debunks Trump's Claim On Tylenol, Autism
content: Reviving debunked theories about vaccines and autism, US President Donald Trump went on television on Monday and insisted that pregnant women should never take Tylenol, a commonly used painkiller in the United States.

title: Paracetamol Linked To Autism? Ex-WHO Chief Scientist Refutes Trump's Claims
content: Dr Swaminathan's remarks came in response to the US President Donald Trump linking the painkiller Tylenol, with paracetamol (acetaminophen) being the main ingredient, to autism.

title: Samajwadi Party Leader Azam Khan To Walk Out Of Jail After 23 Months
content: Senior Samajwadi Party (SP) leader and former Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Mohammad Azam Khan is set to be released from Sitapur jail on Tuesday after remaining behind bars for nearly 23 months.

title: Maharashtra Man's Scooter Slips Into Pothole, Tanker Runs Over Him, Dies
content: A 55-year-old man died after his scooter slipped into a pothole and he was run over by a tanker in Maharashtra's Palghar district, police said on Tuesday.

title: Latest projections for all 46 postseason CFB games
content: the five highest-ranked conference champions will make the field . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8 . this season's national championship game will be played in the new year's six bowls .

title: Baku has Verstappen smelling blood in the water, McLaren hearing 'Jaws' theme

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: the WNBA semifinals are underway, and the sixth-seeded Indiana Fever made a statement in the opening game . the higher seed will host games 1, 2, 5 and 7 for the first time . it will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) .

title: Why Packers' offensive struggles in loss to Browns could be long-term concern
content: right tackle Zach Tom aggravated the oblique injury that kept him out the previous week . the big problem was an afternoon-long struggle for Jordan Love & Co . love was sacked five times, tying for the most in his career, while Jacobs rushed for only 30 yards .
